result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac C Vander Linden

10:26 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Isaac C Vander Linden in court without counsel. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant will be contacting the Public Defender Office.

Hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Prior: 862 Daisy Circle, Hudson, WI 54016 United States

(Case called at 11:32 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Isaac Vander Linden appeared by video without counsel. ADA Andrew Gunderson appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives reading of the complaint. State raises competency concerns. Court has discussion with Defendant. Court adjourns any ruling regarding competency concerns raised by State. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. Defendant updates address. Bond will be mailed to the Defendant to sign and return to the Clerk of Courts. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 09/26/2022 at 1:30 PM. 
Hearing: 10/13/2022 at 9:30 AM.
Letter to defendant with signature bond ordered in court 09/01/2022. Request to return signed bond and Affidavit of Witness form to Clerk of Court no later than 09/12/2022.

Defendant not to have violent/abusive contact or acts/threats of violence toward anyone.

to Quash Warrant.
